resources.name: Create a Code
resources.description: Collect the user's email address and sents it to the **POST /code** endpoint. A six digit code will be sent to the user's email account. The code should then be sent to GET /token to receive a JWT token to use with other endpoints. Most email gateways will accept an email address and enter it into a queue to be delivered in the future. This does not guarantee delivery. This endpoint will return a status=201 once the gateway "accepts" the email address for delivery, though it might fail in the future. --- POST /user/code --- ## Parameters | Name | Type | In | Description | | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | | Content-Type | strint | header | ^ application/x-www-form-urlencoded | | Accept | string | header | application/json or application/xml | | email | string | body | ^ user's email address | > ^ required, Accept defaults application/json --- ## Usage ```bash # CURL curl -d "email=me@domain.com" \ -H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" \ -H "Accept:application/json" \ -X POST http://localhost:3001/user/code | json_pp ``` ```javascript # Javascript const axios = require('axios'); const options = { "headers": {"Accept": "application/json", "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"} }; const resp = await axios.post("/user/code", {"email":"me@domain.com"}, options) console.log(resp.data); ``` --- ## Status ```text - 200 OK - 400 Bad Request - 429 To Many Requests - 431 Request Header Fields Too Large - 500 Internal server error ``` ## JSON ```json { "user": { "email": "warren@wyosoft.com", "code": "A code was sent to the email address." } } ``` ## XML ```xml warren@wyosoft.com A code was sent to the email address. ```

params.name: email
params.value: {% prompt 'Email Address', 'Please enter your email address. We will send you a code.', '', '', false, true %}

resources.name: Notes
resources.description:
# Notes

Notes is a demonstration Node.js backend to illustrate the use of [Docsify](docsifyjs.org) to write an API Reference Guide and other Documentation.

parameters.name: code
parameters.value: {% prompt 'Code', 'Enter the code sent to you', '', '', false, true %}

resources.name: Get user's Notes
resources.description: Gets a list of all notes associated with the user's email address. There is search functionality to limit the list by its content and tags. In addition pagination using skip and limit. If skip=0 and limit=100 then the first 100 notes will be returned. If skip=100 and limit=100 then the next group of 100 notes will be returned. - **/notes** (all notes) - **/notes?skip=0&limit=25** (first 25 notes, 1-25) - **/notes?skip=25&limit=25** (notes 26-50) - **/notes?content=Madison** (notes with Madison in the content) - **/notes?tags=Saturday%20Tuesday** (notes with Satruday or Tuesday in the tags) - **/notes?content=Madison&skip=0&limit=25** (first 25 notes with Madison in the content) --- GET /notes --- **Parameters** | Name | Type | In | Description | | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | | Accept | string | header | application/json or application/xml | | Authorization | string | header | ^ Bearer JWT-token | | content | string | query | text to search note content by | | tags | string | query | text to search note tags by | ^ required --- ### Examples ##### **CURL** ```bash curl -d "email=me@mydomain.com" \ -H "Accept:application/json" \ -H "Authorization: Bearer 1234FRTG67" \ -X GET https://docs-as-code.herokuapp.com/notes | json_pp ``` ##### **Javascript** ```javascript const axios = require('axios'); const options = { "headers": {"Authorization": "Bearer 1234FRTG67", "Accept":"application/json"} }; const resp = await axios.get("https://docs-as-code.herokuapp.com/notes", options) console.log(resp.data); ``` --- ### Response ##### **Status** ```text - 200 OK - 400 Bad Request - 401 Unauthorized - 429 To Many Requests - 431 Request Header Fields Too Large - 500 Internal server error ``` ##### **JSON** ```json { "notes": [ { "id": "-UB_Ja5Qq", "email": "warren@wyosoft.com", "content": "Sent a new token.", "tags": "token", "ddtm": "2020-10-17T13:52:22.027Z" }, { "id": "AU7_Ja5Us", "email": "warren@wyosoft.com", "content": "My first note.", "tags": "today", "ddtm": "2020-10-16T11:12:11.047Z" } ] } ``` ##### **XML** ```xml -UB_Ja5Qq me@mydomain.com Sent a new token. token 2020-10-17T13:52:22.027Z -AU7_Ja5Us me@mydomain.com My first note. today 2020-10-16T11:12:11.047Z ```
